problem_text:
∗20.88. Let u be an element of a free group Fr. Is it true that there is v ∈ Fr (that depends on u) that cannot be a subword of any cyclically reduced word φ(u), where φ is an automorphism of Fr?
V. Shpilrain
answer: Yes, it is true (L. Koch-Hyde, S. O’Connor, E. Olive, V. Shpilrain, Preprint, 2025, https://arxiv.org/abs/2505.00477).
